definitions.definition: ( obsolete , intransitive ) To make a short blast on a horn . [from late 14th c.]
( obsolete , intransitive ) To break wind . [from 18th c.]

examples: His horse pooped right in the middle of the parade.

subdefinitions.definition: ( informal , transitive ) To defecate in or on something.
examples: You might want a spare change of underwear in case you poop your pants.

subdefinitions.definition: ( informal , reflexive ) To defecate on one's person.
examples: You'll poop yourself if you have to walk all five miles home without stopping.

main_definition: ( obsolete , intransitive ) To make a short blast on a horn . [from late 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , intransitive ) To break wind . [from 18th c.]

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To tire , exhaust . [from early 20th c.]
examples: I'm pooped from working so hard.

definitions.definition: ( reflexive ) ( with out ) To become tired and exhausted.
examples: He pooped out a few strides from the finish line.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To tire , exhaust . [from early 20th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( reflexive ) ( with out ) To become tired and exhausted.

definitions.definition: To break seawater with the poop (stern) of a vessel, especially the poop deck .
To break over the stern of (a vessel).
examples: We were pooped within hailing of the quay and were nearly sunk.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To break seawater with the poop (stern) of a vessel, especially the poop deck .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To break over the stern of (a vessel).
